requirement_tested: A frontend application that fetches all dynamic data from backend APIs
user_persona: A visitor browsing the family event portal to find recent obituaries.
user_goal: To view the latest obituaries loaded dynamically from the backend API.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Maria opens the website and expects to see a list of recently published obituaries.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage URL in browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend makes a GET request to /api/obituaries and displays the fetched obituaries in a scrollable list.

requirement_tested: A backend API service that connects to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A developer deploying the backend service.
user_goal: To confirm the backend successfully connects to the PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Server
narrative_steps.description: The developer runs the backend server and checks if it initializes without connection errors.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend server using npm run dev.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server logs indicate successful connection to PostgreSQL using DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, etc.

requirement_tested: Obituary publishing functionality allowing users to create and manage obituaries
user_persona: A family member wanting to publish an obituary for their loved one.
user_goal: To successfully create and save a new obituary entry.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Obituary Form
narrative_steps.description: John logs in and navigates to the 'Publish Obituary' section.
narrative_steps.action: Click on 'Publish Obituary' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: An empty form with fields like full name, date of birth/death, biography, and image URL appears.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting New Obituary
narrative_steps.description: John fills out all required fields and submits the form.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in form fields and click Submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Form data is sent via POST /api/obituaries and the new obituary is saved in the database.

requirement_tested: Funeral arrangements publishing functionality allowing users to create and manage funeral details
user_persona: A funeral planner setting up event details for an upcoming service.
user_goal: To add and later edit funeral arrangement information.

narrative_steps.title: Creating Funeral Arrangement
narrative_steps.description: Sarah logs in and creates a new funeral arrangement with location and time.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to 'Manage Arrangements', fill form, and click Submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: New arrangement is created via POST /api/arrangements and visible in her list.

narrative_steps.title: Editing Existing Arrangement
narrative_steps.description: Later, Sarah realizes she made a typo and wants to correct the event time.
narrative_steps.action: Click Edit next to the arrangement, modify time, then click Update.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: PUT /api/arrangements/:id updates the record and reflects changes immediately.

requirement_tested: Mortuary list display showing available mortuaries with relevant information
user_persona: A bereaved person looking for nearby mortuary services.
user_goal: To browse through a list of available mortuaries and their contact details.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Mortuary List
narrative_steps.description: Emily visits the 'Find Mortuaries' page to look for options near her area.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll down the mortuary list displayed on the page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Multiple mortuary entries are shown with names, addresses, phone numbers, and emails in styled cards.

requirement_tested: Condolences messaging system enabling users to view and leave messages on others' obituaries
user_persona: A friend wishing to express sympathy after reading an obituary.
user_goal: To leave a condolence message on someone else’s obituary.

narrative_steps.title: Reading Obituary Details
narrative_steps.description: Alex reads about his old colleague and decides to offer condolences.
narrative_steps.action: Open the obituary detail page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Obituary content is displayed along with a list of previous condolence messages below it.

narrative_steps.title: Leaving a Condolence Message
narrative_steps.description: Alex types a heartfelt message into the condolence form and submits it.
narrative_steps.action: Type message in text box and click Submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Message is posted via POST /api/obituaries/:id/condolences and now appears in the message list.

requirement_tested: Statistical analysis dashboard displaying relevant metrics and data visualizations
user_persona: A site administrator reviewing overall usage trends.
user_goal: To view statistical insights about obituaries and user engagement.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Statistics Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Admin logs in and goes to the analytics dashboard to review performance.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the Statistics tab.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Charts and stats load from GET /api/statistics showing total obituaries, recent activity, and top users.

narrative_steps.title: Filtering Time Range
narrative_steps.description: Admin selects a custom date range to focus on recent activity.
narrative_steps.action: Choose 'Last Month' option and click Apply Filters.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dashboard reloads with updated data filtered by selected time range.

requirement_tested: User authentication and authorization system for managing personal obituaries and arrangements
user_persona: A registered user trying to access private sections of the portal.
user_goal: To securely log in and manage only their own obituaries.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: Robert returns to the site and needs to access his personal dashboard.
narrative_steps.action: Enter credentials in the login form and click Login.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Credentials are validated via POST /api/auth/login; JWT token is stored and Robert is redirected to his dashboard.

narrative_steps.title: Managing Personal Content
narrative_steps.description: Robert tries to view and update his own obituaries.
narrative_steps.action: Visit 'My Obituaries' section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Only obituaries linked to Robert’s user ID are displayed, and he sees Edit/Delete options.

requirement_tested: Multimedia memory storage and display capability for images and videos
user_persona: A family member uploading photos to accompany an obituary.
user_goal: To upload and view multimedia content related to a loved one.

narrative_steps.title: Uploading Media File
narrative_steps.description: Lisa wants to attach childhood pictures to her father’s obituary.
narrative_steps.action: Click the Upload button in the media gallery section and select image files.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Files are submitted to POST /api/media/upload and thumbnails appear in the gallery.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Uploaded Media
narrative_steps.description: After uploading, Lisa wants to verify the images were added correctly.
narrative_steps.action: Click on one of the uploaded thumbnails.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Image expands in a modal viewer for better viewing experience.

requirement_tested: Responsive web design with cornsilk colored outer layout and peru colored UI blocks
user_persona: A mobile user accessing the portal while away from home.
user_goal: To navigate the portal smoothly on a small-screen device.

narrative_steps.title: Browsing on Mobile Device
narrative_steps.description: Emma opens the site on her smartphone to read condolences left for her aunt.
narrative_steps.action: Resize window or simulate mobile view in browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adjusts responsively, maintaining readability and usability with cornsilk background and peru UI blocks intact.

requirement_tested: Search functionality to find obituaries and funeral arrangements
user_persona: Someone searching for a specific obituary by name.
user_goal: To quickly locate an obituary using the search bar.

narrative_steps.title: Using Search Bar
narrative_steps.description: Mike remembers seeing an obituary but can’t recall which page it was on.
narrative_steps.action: Type the deceased person's name into the search bar and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Results matching the query are returned from GET /api/search?q=:query and displayed in a list.

requirement_tested: Data persistence layer using PostgreSQL database for all dynamic content
user_persona: System maintainer verifying data integrity post-deployment.
user_goal: To ensure that all user-generated content persists correctly in the database.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Data Persistence
narrative_steps.description: Maintainer adds a test obituary and checks whether it remains after refresh.
narrative_steps.action: Create a sample obituary via UI, then reload the page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Created obituary still exists in the list, confirming data has been persisted in the PostgreSQL table.

requirement_tested: Package.json configuration with 'install:all' script for installing frontend and backend dependencies
user_persona: Developer setting up the project locally for the first time.
user_goal: To install all necessary packages for both frontend and backend efficiently.

narrative_steps.title: Running Install Script
narrative_steps.description: Dev clones the repo and wants to get everything ready quickly.
narrative_steps.action: Run 'npm run install:all' in terminal at root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both client and server dependencies are installed concurrently without manual intervention.

requirement_tested: Package.json configuration with 'dev' script for running frontend and backend concurrently
user_goal: To start both frontend and backend servers with one command.

narrative_steps.title: Launching Development Environment
narrative_steps.description: Dev wants to begin coding and testing changes seamlessly.
narrative_steps.action: Execute 'npm run dev' in the root folder.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend services start simultaneously and communicate properly via localhost ports.

requirement_tested: RESTful API endpoints for all data operations including CRUD for obituaries, arrangements, and messages
user_persona: API consumer building an external tool integrating with the portal.
user_goal: To perform create, read, update, and delete actions programmatically.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Create Endpoint
narrative_steps.description: Tool attempts to create a new obituary entry via API call.
narrative_steps.action: Send POST request to /api/obituaries with valid payload.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: New obituary is created in the database and response contains the newly generated ID.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Read Endpoint
narrative_steps.description: Tool retrieves the same obituary to verify its existence.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to /api/obituaries/{id}.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Response returns the correct obituary data matching the ID.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Update Endpoint
narrative_steps.description: Tool modifies some fields in the retrieved obituary.
narrative_steps.action: Send PUT request to /api/obituaries/{id} with modified data.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Record in the database is updated accordingly and confirmed by re-fetching.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Delete Endpoint
narrative_steps.description: Finally, tool deletes the obituary to clean up test data.
narrative_steps.action: Send DELETE request to /api/obituaries/{id}.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Obituary no longer exists in the database and subsequent GET returns 404.
